description: Borrowed from Hindustani حَبَّہ‎ / हब्बा (habbā), from Classical Persian حبه‎ (habba), from Arabic حَبَّة‎ (ḥabba).

examples: Diamonds and pearls are sold by hubbas and ruttees; 8 hubbas equal to 1 ruttee, about 2 grains troy.

entries.meaning: (India, obsolete) A jot or tittle; the smallest amount.
examples: The camp Banyans, to make their purchases of him, pay the assize your Highness may fix, and not a hubba shall be taken without payment being made.
